newsitem.title: USA: Musicland October same store sales down.
newsitem.headline: Musicland October same store sales down.

text.p: Musicland Stores Corp said Thursday its same store sales for the four weeks ended November 2 declined 3.1 percent.
Total sales for that period decreased 0.4 percent to $111.9 million versus $112.3 million for the period ended October 28, 1995.
Sales for the Superstores Division, including Media Play and On Cue, increased 8.4 percent, and comparable-store sales declined 2.0 percent.
Sales for the Mall Stores Division, including Sam Goody and Suncoast Motion Picture Company, declined 4.8 percent with comparable-store sales down 3.6 percent.
Year-to-date, Musicland's sales increased 7.3 percent to $1.232 billion from $1.148 billion in the same period last year. Comparable-store sales year-to-date declined 2.0 percent.

"While we are disappointed in our October sales performance, all of our efforts are focused on executing merchandising and marketing plans for the holiday selling season," Reid Johnson, Musicland's executive vice president and chief financial officer, said in a statement. "The company continues to work closely with Smith Barney to pursue all strategic alternatives to improve the company's financial condition."
